result.execSummary:
The defendant Lino M Cortez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Consecutive to: 15CM00404

miscConds.notes: Bail to be applied to costs.  Any remainder costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Defendant to provide DNA sample.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lino M Cortez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC 12/3/15.
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Lino M Cortez in court with attorney John Paul Marchan.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  Parties expect this matter will resolve with a change of plea.  Court will set all matters except for 15CM404 and 15CM1031 for trial.  15CM404 and 15CM1031 to tag along for further scheduling.  Hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.

COURT ORDERED A $200.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $500.00 SIGNATURE BOND.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

COURT ORDERED A $200.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $500.00 SIGNATURE BOND.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Defendant Lino M Cortez in court with attorney John Paul Marchan.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldonado appeared as interpreter.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
